question: Let V be a finite-dimensional vector space and T: V → V a linear operator. Prove or disprove: If all eigenvalues of T have absolute value less than 1, then T^n → 0 as n → ∞ (operator convergence).
Compute the fundamental group π₁(S¹ ∨ S¹), where ∨ denotes the wedge sum of topological spaces.
Solve the PDE u_t = u_{xx} on (0,π)×(0,∞) with boundary conditions u(0,t)=0, u(π,t)=0 and initial condition u(x,0)=x(π−x).
Let (X,𝔅,μ) be a measure space and f_n → f almost everywhere with |f_n| ≤ g for an integrable function g. State and justify the theorem that guarantees ∫ f_n → ∫ f.
Evaluate the integral ∫_{ℝ} e^{−x²} cos(ax) dx for a real parameter a.
Show that the series ∑_{n=2}^∞ 1/(n (ln n)^p) converges if and only if p > 1.
Given a compact Riemannian manifold (M,g), show that the Laplace–Beltrami operator Δ has a discrete spectrum with eigenvalues 0 ≤ λ₁ ≤ λ₂ ≤ ... → ∞.
Let G be a finite group acting on a set X. Prove Burnside’s lemma for counting orbits: |X/G| = (1/|G|) ∑_{g∈G} |Fix(g)|.
Show that every bounded sequence in ℝⁿ has a convergent subsequence.
In ℂ, determine all analytic functions f such that |f(z)| = |z| for all z.
